comments.body: I just thought of this and came here to post my idea but it looks like it isn’t just me who wants this. I think this would be really cool especially because I love the music in this game to get a new disc every update that can only be obtained through something new from that update.
I think it would suit the system better if it came as disc fragments which we had to craft together.
Then just turn off volume wile caving
Turn off ambient sounds

Flobyhob 
Then you can't hear anything. Including lava and incoming monsters.
Can't you just get used to it like everyone else?

I agree, there is no need for inability to disable very unsettling/downright creepy sounds. I know they are just soundbytes but I swear they really get to me anyway and fills me with anxiety and paranoia.
you can turn them off
yeah, I'm not a fan of these either. They're not that creepy noises, but they get to me a lot for some reason.
minecraft should turn off cave sounds this sounds dum but if i here a cave sound i think that herobrine is gonna appear i my screen >:( and please bring back notch
I like your idea, hopefully those of Mojang can implement that feature on java and bedrock
Oh man, this is so underrated!
Now that we have custom music for oceans and nether biomes on both java and bedrock, it should be possible for them to allow us to customize this feature!
Custom music and, sound in minecraft bedrock edition and, minecraft pocket edition with resources pack?
bruh yeah, i want to add music to warped forests but i know it will just play in any biome
I feel ki should play somewhere else, but I very much agree with kyoto and flake playing in the mountains.
FISH SLAP! Who wants one?
Flopping fish should also slap the player if they get close to the players face
Why not an eelslap?
Made me laugh! Good luck with your idea!
If this isn't implemented I'll probably just make a mod of it lol

Notch officially named it "Magnetic Circuit", so you should get it by getting a skeleton to kill a charged creeper.

It would be that one insane music disc that could give you an achievement for getting it.
Texture for the disc (since it resembles the Mojang Specifications logo)
I do agree with this its the only good song
I agree that it should be added officially as a music disc, but there is a mod for the latest version that adds it: https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/calm4-ogg-music-disc-edition
How about It be a hidden achievement.
add it for the ender dragon as a disc that drops after killing it
it would be an amazing idea

disk info:

Magnetic circuit

by <i forgot what his real name was>
This is a very good idea! Especially with its use for the skulk sensor.

I just don't get it. This isn't the only device issue reported on the bug tracker where people are saying their device works with every other game including Minecraft:Java Edition. There are reports saying that about other audio brands and setups, about keyboards, mouses and controllers, and about connectivity issues, and now with RenderDragon about GPUs/chipsets as well. Bedrock is supposed to be the cross-platform version. Supporting all hardware and setups that Java Edition supports should be a baseline.

Here in 2022—this is still a problem. It infuriates me that this bug still persists as an issue 6 years after it had been reported. A severe bug like this—that makes the game unplayable for those who get easily nauseous—should be fixed immediately. No if's, and's, or but's.

The Bedrock Team needs to be aware that this is a severe issue and at least make an attempt to fixing it. I dislike that I have to play the game muted/with my PC speakers rather than with my headphones that have worked for every game that I've played (along with Minecraft: Java Editon).

I know there are a lot of posts out there, including in the official bug tracker, that say to use your speakers instead of your headset but that isn't a viable option for everyone. Personally, I can't do it because I'm a streamer, and game audio coming out of my speakers is picked up by my microphone causing audio issues on stream. For me it's an inconvenience, however, some people are hard of hearing and cannot hear the game sounds correctly without a headset. For them it's an accessibility issue and as such should not have been allowed to go uncorrected for so long.

It is unreasonable for Microsoft or Mojang to just brush this issue aside the way they have for so long. As others have said previously, Bedrock is supposed to be the cross-platform version and as such should have a greater level of compatibility than Java. When the issue has been reported across so wide a range of hardware and software with the only common factor being Minecraft Bedrock edition, it becomes clear where the issue lies. No one should be expected to uninstall and reinstall their audio programs just to play the Bedrock version.
4 years later this is still a problem. No real way I've been able to find that fixes this. So for now we stay using java edition.
You can never add too much C418 music to Minecraft
I agree! Neither can you add too much Lena Reine music too!
C418 intentionally didn’t add this track to the game, that way the album wouldn’t be a clone of what was in the game already.
I definitely agree. The somewhat spooky atmosphere of the song would fit really well in the deep dark.
Yes! An epic sound for enchanting, maybe something like the chest opening sound in Zelda.
Good idea, on bedrock this sounds are missing
And a special sound for an enchanted tool breaking. maybe like a softer, kinda auditorially "luminous" sound along with the break?
The should totaly add this to minecraft
My game into the multiplier
Plz mojang add voice chat plz

If Minecraft had built-in voice chat, more people would use Minecraft Realms instead of external servers.
It would make Realms more attractive for friends playing together.
Please add

I've been hoping for some sort of update to Minecraft's ambience and sound effects, because I think the game as of now is a bit lifeless when it comes to the world and its surroundings. The music just isn't enough, so I'd love for the team to give Minecraft's sound effects some polishing, and this suggestion would be a great start to that.
Be sure to vote for yourself!
I really like this idea; it allows for more complex music in minecraft.

I think wool would be better for a muffling effect, given the recent Wool Occlusion mechanic. I'd be most excited with the glass pane idea so that note blocks could have some degree of sustain to their sound - as-is, they are very staccato (short-lived tones), which makes many slower songs harder to translate into note blocks. Not sure how the leaves/noise idea would work with all the different types of instruments now in the game, but the glowstone echo could be cool too.
due to new added copper, they could be copper pipes that make the note longer
It would also be nice to have an update to how the actual sounds produced, although that isn't very important. Texture packs could be used to help with that a little.

Great idea!

There are two aspects of note blocks that I would like to see being modifiable (either by putting a block on top/below or including it in the recipe)

1) Direction of sound - skulk block - Putting a skulk block on top of the note block (or including it in the recipe, or through enchantments or the insertion of music sheets into the note block) should make the note a surround sound, rather than a directional one.
I have tried my hand at creating an ambient environment (a tavern) with music. Unfortunately, the illusion was quickly dispelled by the fact that you need to look in the general direction of where the notes are playing for the sound to work as intended. Following a redstone contraption to hear a piece of music only works for a video about itself, but does not actually fit into the context of the game. It would be great to have a way to modify the direction, and doing it with a skulk block makes sense in my mind as it would add to the scare-factor that this block can make sound appear in your head rather than from a direction.

2) Fade by distance - Putting something on top (or the other previously mentioned methods) (e.g. copper pipes https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360050470971/comments/360014481171) should enable controlling either how far the sounds can be heard or the level of fade. It would help with making longer pieces that one can listen to in a single spot. It should be possible to combine it with the surround sound mode.
That would be a nice touch.
I think a slow beat with a majestic sounding tune would be great for the ocean.

I agree! Slightly different variations to the original Minecraft music for each biome would be amazing! Christmas sounding music for the tundra, Egyptian sounding music for the desert, and things like that for different biomes would be nice.
no. the composer for Minecraft's music even said that he did not want biome-specific music.

Yes please! I’m not hard of hearing and there are times when I’d rather play with no sounds but would still like to know what is going on in the environment. It’s frustrating that this is a feature on Java but not bedrock. I play on an iPad.
I personally don't have any disabilities but I do agree that this should be added as there are some times that people can't have audio playing and can't put on headphones
I am hard of hearing, I play Java edition because of the subtitles. I purchased Bedrock, then returned it to the store and refuse to play it further until captions are put in.
Ty
No i like cave sounds
سلام سرور بقا رو میخوام
Nah mojang should leave them in so that bedrock edition players can suffer where as us Java edition players can just use a resource pack or a mod
i actually play the trumpet
it actually already makes a unique sound on bedrock edition, although it has not made it to java edition
I'm glad someone else thought of this, too! We need more brass in the game, imo

ill add onto this, make it the trumpet we hear with the new goat horns.
and make the copper block potentially have a lower version of the horn... am i right?
I agree. A trumpet sound would be great because nearly everyone has built a castle at one time or another, and it would lend itself really well for those builds.
Their launch sound should be stretched to fit the launch time.
Yess, the fireworks more like firewoosh
Having to resort to turning music of in options feels clunky indeed

Just to add to this, I think a big question is how exactly to implement it, a big issue is how directional the discs are. It might suck if someone is just playing the game and listening to their favorite tune and their bud waltzes near them and cuts out all their music. In the Bedrock edition at least, I think a solution is possible, instead of cutting out the song entirely, just have the music still loaded and technically playing but entirely muted. Once you leave the bounding box in which discs can no longer be heard (64.0) the music you were previously hearing just fades back in, similar to the music transitions they included on the main menu screen when loading into a game.
You can never get enough cave ambience, there should be some sort of looping track similar to underwater and nether ambience.
Yes, we need more and better ambiences in general for Overworld (Surface and caves) and the End, just like how the Nether has right now with 1.16.
I want the cave ambience to be actual cave noises, not some train whistle or some screeching from hell
I think we could get some biome specfic cave sounds, so maybe some really alien scary one for the deep dark, and maybe stones faling for the dripstone cave
Whole heartedly agree
I think the sound of water dripping would add some nice ambiance. Also in larger caves all the sounds should echo.
Definitely would be a good addition.
How about a blend of the two?
YESSSSS!!!!!!! In my survival world, i'm in a mushroom island and when i drink (eat) mushroom stew, it sounds so weird! This change needs in minecraft.

I support this! Flake is a really good song and I think its sound event could be triggered by either of the following:

- It starts snowing

- The player is in a cold biome

I'm all for biome-dependent music!

Thanks! I actually didn't think about this playing when it snowed, I just thought it would when entering a cold biome, but now I like the idea even more! I know it's been 21 days, but thanks for the feedback.
This wouldn't be too hard to add to the game through a resource pack. I could probably set one up for you if you'd like.

I agree, this is really needed! I recently discovered a couple of amazing tracks (Blind Spots and Aria Math) that I had been missing out on for years because I just always play in survival. These should definitely be allowed everywhere.
I 100% agree! It baffles me why they split the soundtrack up to begin with!

I mean, this would sound cool, but the purpose of the creative music is to feel like you have all this power to create anything  you want. In survival, the purpose of the music is to feel relaxed in a world where you sometimes never know what could happen. so I will say to keep them separate.
There’s a simple compromise between putting the whole soundtrack in both modes and keeping them entirely separate: put the creative tracks on music discs so you have to find them in survival mode.
Sigive Bjorkedal can you leave instructions on how to do that

You know, they should also add a new remix of Aria Math made by both C418 and another artist called Protostar. I'm not going to say in-depth on how it is because so many people haven't heard it or listened to it yet. It's really awesome. After you listen to it on Spotify, write your comments here.
